m1.title: Structures & Peices
m1.info:
The memorial is of remmberence of Queen Mary's visit for the opening of the Little Titchford Street campus in 1929. 4 - 12 Little Titchfield Street was known at the time as the Great Portland Street Annexe, was opened for the craft schools of the Regent Street Polytechnic.

The painting is awesome.

Ben Joiner an artist of the University of Westminster designed the dramatic arresting metal sculptures seen outsisde the Cavendish campus.

answers.c: On the first floor library entrance
answers.d: Outside the fith floor study labs

q2.title: Where can this painting be found?

answers.d: Near reception towards the first floor

q3.title: Have you seen this sculpture anywhere?

m2.title: Food & Entertainment
m2.info:
Regent Street Univeristy Student Gym
The University of Westminster believes in it 's students and supports them in their drive, ambitions and determinsation
Located in the heart of London,
just a short walk from bustling Oxford Street,
is Regent Street gym.
>> Facilities
Our gym offers cardio and weights facilities,
and general floor space
for stretching or free weights.we also have clean and pleasant changing,
shower and locker facilities,
as well as towels to hire.
Four highly qualified and experienced sports and exercise scientists are on hand to offer fitness assessments,
body composition analysis,
personal training,
nutrition and weight loss advice,
and prepare tailored fitness plans.
>> Classes
The classes we offer at Regent Street gym include spin,
TRX,
Zumba,
Boxfit,
Pilates and yoga.
Student opening hours
Monday to Thursday: 8 am� 9 pm
Friday: 8 am� 7.30 pm
Saturday: closed
Sunday: 11.30 am� 3 pm

Gym Prices

The Gallery
Located at our 309 Regent Street site,
the Gallery Cafe is open to students,
staff and the general public.
Its affordable prices and central location make it an excellent meeting point
for working lunches and informal meetings.

Cafe neo
located in the Cavendish campus,
you can find everything you need to keep you going through your day.Its a nice place to hang out with freinds,
eat some hot food or just socialise in your spare time.
Hot and cold drinks are also on sale just ask one of the freindly staff and they will be happy to assist you with more information on whats available.

m4.title: Classrooms
m4.info:
Interpretation Practice Rooms
Situated on the upper fourth floor of 301 Regent Street,
a dedicated learning area
for Modern Languages students has been created.
The space encourages greater interaction between staff and students and includes new state - of - the - art language labs
for Interpreting and Translation students plus attractive offices for staff.
